description: From Arabic دِرْهَم‎ (dirham), ultimately from Ancient Greek δραχμή (drakhmḗ). Doublet of dram, drachma, diram, dirhem, and adarme.

entries.meaning: A unit of currency used in the Arab world, currently the name of the currency of Morocco and the United Arab Emirates.
(historical units of measurement) Alternative form of dirhem: a former Turkish unit of weight.
